Posts.Content: kjm101 wrote: hi, i am new...i had a ct scan for stomach issues and the hospital that did the ct called me 2 days later to tell me there was an incidental finding of mass on my r breast.  This all happened about three weeks age.  My doctor sent me to have a mammogram done that day and also ended up having a u/s done the same day.  The next day they were sending me to a breast surgeon who sent for an mri of my breasts, then 5 days later they sent me for an mri vacuum assisted biopsy which showed multiple areas of ALH and DH and a small papilloma.  I am having a wire guided excisional biopsy done May 11th.  I am very nervous!!!!!!!!!  All of this is happening so fast.  Any advice??   Please and thank you. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: anxious kjm101 jdfnj

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2010 07:00AM kjm101 wrote: Linda, I am so glad I signed up for this website I spent a week looking at forums on here before I signed up...I was nervous to sign up...why I dont know. Everyone has had wonderful info to share.  Thanks...I will keep u posted and I hope that you are well. Kim
Posts.Title: anxious kjm101 jdfnj

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2010 07:04AM kjm101 wrote: Kwolf,   Hi.  Hope everything goes well with your biopsy...I know exactly how you feel.  One minute I am fine and the next I am a total wreck.  This all still kind of seems a little to surreal for me at times.  Yes, I agree the ladies on here are wonderful.  Please keep me posted with your upcoming biopsy and I will keep you in my prayers. Kim
Posts.Title: anxious kjm101 jdfnj

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2010 09:40PM kjm101 wrote: Linda,    Thanks for your reply. I know I need to relax...my husband has been wonderful telling me to relax it will be fine.  I do believe him.  I just don't know how to explain to him all the emotions I am feeling right now.  I know it is normal, but I am usually the caretaker of everyone...not the one to be taken care of.  I hope this all turns out to be nothing!!!  Once again thanks! Kim
Posts.Title: anxious kjm101 jdfnj

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2010 07:12AM kjm101 wrote: Jen,   I wish the best of luck on surgery coming up and I will keep you in my prayers.  Maybe now that I am on this website and getting good info I will be able to relax a little more.  I am going to talk to my Dr about xanax...it would be nice to sleep a full night.  Once again thanks for the reply and keep us posted. Kim
